page.title: 19CALDERSTONES - A PUBLIC PARK
page.content: Calderstones is a large and beautiful public park taking it's name from some {ancient standing stones,}strangely marked, that were found nearby. They can now be seen in one of the park's greenhouses. As you stroll through the park on a sunny Sunday afternoon with others walking off their lunch you will see fine landscaping with many different varieties of trees, a large, ornamental lake complete with ducks and people fishing, little streams passing under quaint rustic bridges, a beautifully styled Japanese garden complete with miniature trees and a bamboo deer scarer, a traditional English walled garden changing with the seasons, and roses galore. In one greenhouse, as you walk through a dripping jungle glade, you spot rare orchids of all kinds. For peace and quiet there is no finer place.
